page.title: 17C.BURTON-POND/SHOP DIKE 1
page.content: The shop referred to was a blacksmiths shop (shown on the 1920 OS). Obviously there would be a ready supply of water for the quenching of hot iron/steel work.Although years ago the pond was fed by springs this has nearly dried up due to main drainage systems within the village's new estates.The springs fed a number of amenity pumps in the Main St.and Highgate (2 still exist) but the biggest loss to the village scene was the removal of the village pump.This was a grand and picturesque structure at the eastern end of the pond (the spring feeding it now lies under the footpath).Unlike the others the pond pump was made of wood,built on a platform 5'above ground,reached by a ladder.Atop this the pump rose 6' Horse drawn water carts took water to outlying fields for the animals,a job usually done by horselads or waggoners
